@bowlofgumbo
Yes, those cards (Ancestral Recall and Time Walk) are inherently broken, but a deck full of just Ancestral Recall and Time Walk is not going to win you the game. It's the other cards in the relevant format that make a card broken.

What makes Geist of Saint Traft broken is that the other cards available in the pool of today's standard aren't good enough to deal with him without some inherent loss. Cards that do deal with him are too narrow or too costly. You can't block him if your opponent plays Restoration Angel or Spectral Flight in their deck. Rolling Temblor is too narrow for the main board, as it does not hit flyers and is sorcery speed. Supreme Verdict comes out a turn too late, and again, sorcery. Barter in Blood and Mutilate will sometim... (see all)

posts.post_content:
Who is the man...er, ghost  
That would risk his neck for his brother man?  
*Traft!*

Who's the cat that won't cop out  
When there's danger all about  
*Traft!*  
Right on...  
  
You see this cat Traft is a bad mother--  
*Shut your mouth!*  
But I'm talkin' about Traft  
  
He's a complicated man  
But no one understands him  
But his women...er, angels  
*Saint Traft*

posts.post_content: A lot of people complain that he doesn't take any skill to play. This is true but the vast majority of cards don't require any skill to play either. In fact as i see it other that a few cards that require constant adjustments ([Morphling](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Morphling) is the one that come quickest to my mind) the only real place you need/use skill is deck building, every were else you pretty much just hope you draw your best cards at the best times.

posts.post_content:
My older bro always finds these neat little cards and we contemplate ways how a single card can lead to sure victory. What is quickly realized though is that no single card will always lead to sure victory. Since we play casual using cards ranging from ye olden days to today, there's always a way to deal with a pest like Mr. Geist.  
  
 Mind Twist him out of your opponent's hand, or use a Hypie or a Duress or a Hymn to Tourach, etc. etc. Counterspell it, or Cancel or Essence Shatter or Mana Leak etc. etc. Wrath of God the battlefield, or Apocalypse everything out of existence even. Diabolic Edict or miss Liliana of the Veil (among a million other cards) are simple ways to force a sac. Fog or Safe Passage is always an annoying method. Your opponent have it enchanted or equipped with something to make it unblockable? Tranquility, Disenchant, Shatter, Naturalize, Smelt, etc. etc. can make it blockable again. Twiddle, Icy Manipulator, Downpour, Sleep, etc. are easy ways to keep him fr... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
